container.heading: Expungement of Public Motor Vehicle Administration Records

section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: The purpose of this chapter is to set standards and procedures for the expungement of a public driving record by the Motor Vehicle Administration, as set forth in Transportation Article, §16-117.1, Annotated Code of Maryland.

section.heading: Expungement of a Public Driving Record.

para.text: The public driving record entries of a licensee that are eligible for expungement shall be expunged within 31 days of becoming eligible for expungement.
Suspensions related to driver safety and revocations shall delay a licensee’s eligibility for expungement as set forth in Transportation Article, §16-117.1, Annotated Code of Maryland.
The Administration has determined that:
The following driver’s license suspensions are not related to driver safety and become eligible for expungement 1 year after the suspension period ends:
Upon death of a co-signer, as set forth in Transportation Article, §16-109, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Failure to pay Child Support, as set forth in Transportation Article, §16-203, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Outstanding Arrest Warrant, as set forth in Transportation Article, §16-204, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Nonpayment of judgment, as set forth in Transportation Article, §17-204, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Dispensing of motor fuel into a dirt bike in Baltimore City, as set forth in Transportation Article, §21-1128, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Failure to appear or comply, as set forth in Transportation Article, §26-204, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Failure to pay, as set forth in Transportation Article, §27-103, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Possession of alcohol by a minor, as set forth in Criminal Law, §10-114 and Courts and Judicial Proceedings, §3-8A-19;
Failure to pay for motor fuel, as set forth in Criminal Law, §7-104 and Transportation Article, §16-206.1, Annotated Code of Maryland;

Improper use of a driver’s license or identification card by a minor to obtain alcohol, as set forth in Criminal Law Article, §10-113 and Courts and Judicial Proceedings Article, §3-8A-19, Annotated Code of Maryland;

Noncompliance with traffic citation issued under federal law, as set forth in Transportation Article, §26-206 and Nonpayment of fine, as set forth in Transportation Article, §27-103, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
Rejection by Maryland Automobile Insurance Fund, as set forth in Transportation Article, §17-105, Annotated Code of Maryland; and
Driver license suspensions not listed under §C(1) of this regulation are related to driver safety.

section.heading: Refusal to Expunge a Public Driving Record.

para.text: The Administration shall not expunge the public driving record entries of a licensee who:
Is currently:
Refused;
Canceled;
Suspended; or
Revoked;
Has a pending:
Refusal;
Cancellation;
Suspension; or
Revocation;
Has a restricted license in lieu of a driver safety related suspension; or
The Administration has determined has not driven a motor vehicle on the highways during the particular conviction-free period on which the expungement is based.
The Administration shall not expunge certain driving records entries, pursuant to Transportation Article, §16-117.1(d), Annotated Code of Maryland.

The Administration shall not expunge any driving record entries relating to a commercial driver’s license before the expiration of the time they are required to be retained under Transportation Article, §16-819, Annotated Code of Maryland, and in accordance with 49 CFR 384.
